Reviews: excellent app. taught me well about macro nutrition facts.
cleaned_reviews: excellent app taught well macro nutrition fact
positive_reviews_col: excellent app taught well macro nutrition fact
Persona_Insight: Fitbit app used to be excellent. it is in decline unless you pay their monthly subscription! i paid £400 for a piece of tech and can only use its full potential if i keep paying! you can shove it fitbit, no doubt you are making fortunes using all the data you have on us too! i used to love my fitbit and have been a loyal customer for over a decade. the app was always great, simple to use, easy to read, good to see how you were doing over time. recently the app changed but the underlying sections remained usable, now the sleep app has been “updated” it is unusable. we comment but fitbit are ignoring us, time to look at other offerings. Sleep tracking is excellent, easy to use with a simple to learn ui. battery life is brilliant, last several days! superb fitness trackers with a very competitive prices. charge 5 worked perfectly and now i am on charge 6, which is just as good with a minor improvements, all adds up to very smooth user experience. great app for cyclists! it's my every day app for recording my sports activities. the segments feature is super addictive. no problem to pay 59 usd per year for it. keep up the good job by continuously adding features! great product and social experience with a positive effect. Each email takes 3-5 working days to get a response, and in my case the support agent took two of those emails to ask the same question twice (adding 10 days to the resolution) it took weeks to resolve a basic problem. a few months back i started tracking my walks. i do 2 miles a day minimum, and just being able to see all the data set me on my journey to lose weight and get fitter. i now use strava, and garmin app together. very good app. i can build my cycling routes easily and also share them with my fellow-cyclists. strava can connect with multiple cycling computers even those that are sold on aliexpress. which makes it easier to follow the routes i build in the strava app. i have been using strava for nearly 3 years. it's great an compatible with my apple watch. i have rated it 4 stars because the have removed feature, making them "summit" (premium) features. i use this almost daily and apart from the dodgy route planner find the website and app interfaces great. excellent performance but the app hcrashes too much no, put a fix on it. only using the free app version so far for my runs and i really like it.  give it a go. Great website for tracking fitness activities. they could do with more premium features for runners. the site seems very geared towards cyclists. it's a great app, with information that can help people through any type of fitness journey. i appreciate the notifications throughout the day to log my meals. it's super easy to look up the foods i have either by the search bar or barcode. i'd like to see more nutrients/minerals in the nutrient breakdown tab. also less ads would be nice. App has helped me lose weight, eat better, exercise more, reach my goals and stay on track/maintain. great database for tracking food at meals, integration of data to/from other health apps and devices, nice goal setting/tracking features. Great app to track your calories and workouts! searching for food, it is a very thorough and complete database and very easy to find what you need for quick logins. The ability to make and save recipes is a great asset to the app! i've had for 3 years and it's been of invaluable help with my bulking and cutting bodybuilding cycles. brilliant bar code facility. would love if it was possible to duplicate items for multiple meals and days but other than that very user friendly. i’ve used this as a valuable tool to track my calories for the past 8 years. i like that u can put exercises in too. it helps to keep track of the days i exercise, all in one app. i'm amazed by how many foods are in the data bank. if the food i want is not there, i can usually find one similar. the posted columns are very useful and helpful. i especially like the recipes. It's a great app, never a problem with it, like some other apps. great for counting calories & helping me keep track of what i'm eating. shame about the constant bombardment of ads., and the price of premium for a pensioner is a little steep. Great way to track food, and keep on target when loosing or maintaining weight excellent app. taught me well about macro nutrition facts. it’s a good tracking app, however they made the best feature - the ability to scan the upc - only accessible via the paid app. that was a greedy move. This app has helped me on my way of losing 38 pounds in about 3 months! tracking my food and nutritional values has led me to lose 95 lbs. i feel great, too! used for years!! great for calorie counting and keeping track of my nutrition values. Great app easy to use and excellent for daily use. so far the app has helped me lose 18 ibsbrilliant  it is easy to log your foods. has info on many foods and restaurants. great tool. helps me keep track of meals well. excellent as always the best app to use good app. easy to use  used this for years. fantastic my trainer arman at 24 our fitness set this app up for me so that i could track my progress. i also like the articles on recipes and nutritional information, and sometimes i try to make the dishes. the ability to find specific foods from stores and restaurants makes it easy to do your daily check in. another great feature is the bar code reader, meaning less typing. Great app, keeps me honest! really empowers me to reach my fitness goals. beautiful product with many options to assess your meals. i started using the app after a heart attack. i use it track calories, fat, sodium and exercise. it's great. The app helps me track my macros, so i can keep my protein and fat high and carbs low. functionality is great and relatively user friendly. the database often has any food i need. i've kept the extra weight off for 5 years now.  myfitnesspal is amazing! it has been a huge help in my weight loss journey. the food database is huge, and the barcode scanner makes logging meals super easy. it tracks my progress and syncs with my other fitness apps. highly recommend for anyone looking to get healthier!

cleaned_reviews: always enjoyed myfitnesspal used year eventually find something else continue take away feature always free make premium
positive_reviews_col: always enjoyed myfitnesspal used year eventually find something else continue take away feature always free make premium

Persona_Insight: CNN.com will feature iReporter photos in a weekly Travel Snapshots gallery. Please submit your best shots of New York for next week. Visit CNN.com/Travel next Wednesday for a new gallery of snapshots. i love fitbit and am obsessed with my watch. over the past 4 years my fitbit has stopped working twice and both times they ask me to send it back and have sent me a brand new one! not many companies would do that so i think it's great. i generally find it so great for tracking all my exercise too and there’s so much you can do on the app. i would never move to any other watch and always recommend them. my fitbit stopped working, customer service was useless and just offered me discount on a new purchase. when i asked how to make a complaint they went from replying promptly to completely ignoring me. i only wish i'd read the reviews years ago as i certainly would've avoided this company. i know they had a premium service that could go in depth but now all basic functions are behind that paywall. my advice: use a different app. used to be a great app, now they have changed it so you need to pay for the most basic of functions. The app runs well most of the time but sometimes doesn't work as well. other than the negative, a good app. they need to sort the money business out. sort it out strava! good at dealing with specific enquiries on rides, but there are some long highlighted general issues that have been raised many times by different people. happy with the overall use of the site via a pc, not so much so on the app. going the paid route opens up so much more and this is both insightful and in my case, helps motivate me. i find the menu easy to navigate, and the info on calories and nutrients is very helpful. search function in “add a food” has some incorrect calorie counts. system automatically adds my exercise calories to my daily total. i can’t opt out of that without upgrading to premium. i have been using myfitnesspal for many years and i had bariatric surgery 3 years ago and this is a very handy tool to use to track. what i used to like i was able to scan my food for free. however now i write my food in because for scanning it isn't free anymore. i still like tracking calories even though i write them in.  myfitnesspal has become my de facto way of keeping track of calories. its accurate, extremely easy to use and would be difficult to do without. this app has a very extensive data base so makes it easy to track my daily food intake. My fitness pal is a brilliant app for managing everything linked to a healthy lifestyle. it is easy to use and if you subscribe to the premium service then you get fantastic value for money. i personally use the basic service for free as my only requirement is the food diary. you will not be disappointed using my fitness pal, and i will guarantee that. i've been using this app to track workouts and meals for years. i trust its data more than any other app i've used. it’s app is easy to use and they everything imaginable listed! i still use the free app and am tempted to try the updated version. Myfitnesspal is right on. always room for improvement, especially for people who don't eat processed food. having to continually put in ingredients i choose to eat is somewhat challenging, especially since i often substitute the alternative ingredients in recipes. i use mFP to track my weight and calories, and it has helped me achieve my fitness goals through the years. fitness pal is easy to use, to check my daily nutrients (calories, carbs, fiber, etc). most of my meal choices are already included in the data. This app is simple to use and really helps me stay on track. wo helpful and easy. it does what i need it to do when i use it right. it has what i want. i’m a long time user and credit my fitness pal with providing both information and the discipline needed to first lose weight and then maintain. i have many friends who complain about not being able to lose weight but have no clue about how many calories, carbs, fats etc they consume. additionally they don’t understand how few calories are actually needed by the human body per day or the amount of exercise needed per day. i was recently diagnosed with gallbladder and liver issues. myfitnesspal has made it much easier to visualize if i’m achieving my macro and nutrient goals for those conditions. with their premium features, it has been worth it! i like that i can scan food to get the nutrition info. i started the south beach diet at my dr’s recommendation and found it hard to find information within the app to follow it. good to count calories and keep trsvk. expensive to go premium.

Each email takes 3-5 working days to get a response, and in my case the support agent took two of those emails to ask the same question twice (adding 10 days to the resolution) it took weeks to resolve a basic problem. a few months back i started tracking my walks. i do 2 miles a day minimum, and just being able to see all the data set me on my journey to lose weight and get fitter. i now use strava, and garmin app together. very good app. i can build my cycling routes easily and also share them with my fellow-cyclists. strava can connect with multiple cycling computers even those that are sold on aliexpress. which makes it easier to follow the routes i build in the strava app. i have been using strava for nearly 3 years. it's great an compatible with my apple watch. i have rated it 4 stars because the have removed feature, making them "summit" (premium) features. i use this almost daily and apart from the dodgy route planner find the website and app interfaces great. excellent performance but the app hcrashes too much no, put a fix on it. only using the free app version so far for my runs and i really like it.  give it a go. Great website for tracking fitness activities. they could do with more premium features for runners. the site seems very geared towards cyclists. it's a great app, with information that can help people through any type of fitness journey. i appreciate the notifications throughout the day to log my meals. it's super easy to look up the foods i have either by the search bar or barcode. i'd like to see more nutrients/minerals in the nutrient breakdown tab. also less ads would be nice. App has helped me lose weight, eat better, exercise more, reach my goals and stay on track/maintain. great database for tracking food at meals, integration of data to/from other health apps and devices, nice goal setting/tracking features. Great app to track your calories and workouts! searching for food, it is a very thorough and complete database and very easy to find what you need for quick logins. The ability to make and save recipes is a great asset to the app! i've had for 3 years and it's been of invaluable help with my bulking and cutting bodybuilding cycles. brilliant bar code facility. would love if it was possible to duplicate items for multiple meals and days but other than that very user friendly. i’ve used this as a valuable tool to track my calories for the past 8 years. i like that u can put exercises in too. it helps to keep track of the days i exercise, all in one app. i'm amazed by how many foods are in the data bank. if the food i want is not there, i can usually find one similar. the posted columns are very useful and helpful. i especially like the recipes. It's a great app, never a problem with it, like some other apps. great for counting calories & helping me keep track of what i'm eating. shame about the constant bombardment of ads., and the price of premium for a pensioner is a little steep. Great way to track food, and keep on target when loosing or maintaining weight excellent app. taught me well about macro nutrition facts. it’s a good tracking app, however they made the best feature - the ability to scan the upc - only accessible via the paid app. that was a greedy move. This app has helped me on my way of losing 38 pounds in about 3 months! tracking my food and nutritional values has led me to lose 95 lbs. i feel great, too! used for years!! great for calorie counting and keeping track of my nutrition values. Great app easy to use and excellent for daily use. so far the app has helped me lose 18 ibsbrilliant  it is easy to log your foods. has info on many foods and restaurants. great tool. helps me keep track of meals well. excellent as always the best app to use good app. easy to use  used this for years. fantastic my trainer arman at 24 our fitness set this app up for me so that i could track my progress. i also like the articles on recipes and nutritional information, and sometimes i try to make the dishes. the ability to find specific foods from stores and restaurants makes it easy to do your daily check in. another great feature is the bar code reader, meaning less typing. Great app, keeps me honest! really empowers me to reach my fitness goals. beautiful product with many options to assess your meals. i started using the app after a heart attack. i use it track calories, fat, sodium and exercise. it's great. The app helps me track my macros, so i can keep my protein and fat high and carbs low. functionality is great and relatively user friendly. the database often has any food i need. i've kept the extra weight off for 5 years now.  myfitnesspal is amazing! it has been a huge help in my weight loss journey. the food database is huge, and the barcode scanner makes logging meals super easy. it tracks my progress and syncs with my other fitness apps. highly recommend for anyone looking to get healthier!

Reviews: this app makes it easy to track food, exercise and macros.  i have been using this app daily for over a year.
cleaned_reviews: app make easy track food exercise macro using app daily year
negative_reviews_col: app make easy track food exercise macro using app daily year
Persona_Insight: CNN.com will feature iReporter photos in a weekly Travel Snapshots gallery. Please submit your best shots of New York for next week. Visit CNN.com/Travel next Wednesday for a new gallery of snapshots. i love fitbit and am obsessed with my watch. over the past 4 years my fitbit has stopped working twice and both times they ask me to send it back and have sent me a brand new one! not many companies would do that so i think it's great. i generally find it so great for tracking all my exercise too and there’s so much you can do on the app. i would never move to any other watch and always recommend them. my fitbit stopped working, customer service was useless and just offered me discount on a new purchase. when i asked how to make a complaint they went from replying promptly to completely ignoring me. i only wish i'd read the reviews years ago as i certainly would've avoided this company. i know they had a premium service that could go in depth but now all basic functions are behind that paywall. my advice: use a different app. used to be a great app, now they have changed it so you need to pay for the most basic of functions. The app runs well most of the time but sometimes doesn't work as well. other than the negative, a good app. they need to sort the money business out. sort it out strava! good at dealing with specific enquiries on rides, but there are some long highlighted general issues that have been raised many times by different people. happy with the overall use of the site via a pc, not so much so on the app. going the paid route opens up so much more and this is both insightful and in my case, helps motivate me. i find the menu easy to navigate, and the info on calories and nutrients is very helpful. search function in “add a food” has some incorrect calorie counts. system automatically adds my exercise calories to my daily total. i can’t opt out of that without upgrading to premium. i have been using myfitnesspal for many years and i had bariatric surgery 3 years ago and this is a very handy tool to use to track. what i used to like i was able to scan my food for free. however now i write my food in because for scanning it isn't free anymore. i still like tracking calories even though i write them in.  myfitnesspal has become my de facto way of keeping track of calories. its accurate, extremely easy to use and would be difficult to do without. this app has a very extensive data base so makes it easy to track my daily food intake. My fitness pal is a brilliant app for managing everything linked to a healthy lifestyle. it is easy to use and if you subscribe to the premium service then you get fantastic value for money. i personally use the basic service for free as my only requirement is the food diary. you will not be disappointed using my fitness pal, and i will guarantee that. i've been using this app to track workouts and meals for years. i trust its data more than any other app i've used. it’s app is easy to use and they everything imaginable listed! i still use the free app and am tempted to try the updated version. Myfitnesspal is right on. always room for improvement, especially for people who don't eat processed food. having to continually put in ingredients i choose to eat is somewhat challenging, especially since i often substitute the alternative ingredients in recipes. i use mFP to track my weight and calories, and it has helped me achieve my fitness goals through the years. fitness pal is easy to use, to check my daily nutrients (calories, carbs, fiber, etc). most of my meal choices are already included in the data. The app is easy to use and perfect for managing my fitness goals. easy ti use and upload myfeedback which was welcomed by the company i bought from. i've been using it consistently for past 2 months and i'm literally seeing the results on weekly basis. i have been using this app daily for over a year. the workout feature is hit and miss, but basically it works well. it’s easy to communicate with other bikers in the community and share experiences. This app is simple to use and really helps me stay on track. wo helpful and easy. it does what i need it to do when i use it right. it has what i want. i’m a long time user and credit my fitness pal with providing both information and the discipline needed to first lose weight and then maintain. i have many friends who complain about not being able to lose weight but have no clue about how many calories, carbs, fats etc they consume. additionally they don’t understand how few calories are actually needed by the human body per day or the amount of exercise needed per day. i was recently diagnosed with gallbladder and liver issues. myfitnesspal has made it much easier to visualize if i’m achieving my macro and nutrient goals for those conditions. with their premium features, it has been worth it! i like that i can scan food to get the nutrition info. i started the south beach diet at my dr’s recommendation and found it hard to find information within the app to follow it. good to count calories and keep trsvk. expensive to go premium.

Reviews: the workout feature is hit and miss, but basically it works well
cleaned_reviews: workout feature hit miss basically work well
positive_reviews_col: workout feature hit miss basically work well

Persona_Insight: Fitbit app used to be excellent. it is in decline unless you pay their monthly subscription! i paid £400 for a piece of tech and can only use its full potential if i keep paying! you can shove it fitbit, no doubt you are making fortunes using all the data you have on us too! i used to love my fitbit and have been a loyal customer for over a decade. the app was always great, simple to use, easy to read, good to see how you were doing over time. recently the app changed but the underlying sections remained usable, now the sleep app has been “updated” it is unusable. we comment but fitbit are ignoring us, time to look at other offerings. Sleep tracking is excellent, easy to use with a simple to learn ui. battery life is brilliant, last several days! superb fitness trackers with a very competitive prices. charge 5 worked perfectly and now i am on charge 6, which is just as good with a minor improvements, all adds up to very smooth user experience. great app for cyclists! it's my every day app for recording my sports activities. the segments feature is super addictive. no problem to pay 59 usd per year for it. keep up the good job by continuously adding features! great product and social experience with a positive effect. Each email takes 3-5 working days to get a response, and in my case the support agent took two of those emails to ask the same question twice (adding 10 days to the resolution) it took weeks to resolve a basic problem. a few months back i started tracking my walks. i do 2 miles a day minimum, and just being able to see all the data set me on my journey to lose weight and get fitter. i now use strava, and garmin app together. very good app. i can build my cycling routes easily and also share them with my fellow-cyclists. strava can connect with multiple cycling computers even those that are sold on aliexpress. which makes it easier to follow the routes i build in the strava app. i have been using strava for nearly 3 years. it's great an compatible with my apple watch. i have rated it 4 stars because the have removed feature, making them "summit" (premium) features. i use this almost daily and apart from the dodgy route planner find the website and app interfaces great. excellent performance but the app hcrashes too much no, put a fix on it. only using the free app version so far for my runs and i really like it.  give it a go. Great website for tracking fitness activities. they could do with more premium features for runners. the site seems very geared towards cyclists. it's a great app, with information that can help people through any type of fitness journey. i appreciate the notifications throughout the day to log my meals. it's super easy to look up the foods i have either by the search bar or barcode. i'd like to see more nutrients/minerals in the nutrient breakdown tab. also less ads would be nice. App has helped me lose weight, eat better, exercise more, reach my goals and stay on track/maintain. great database for tracking food at meals, integration of data to/from other health apps and devices, nice goal setting/tracking features. Great app to track your calories and workouts! searching for food, it is a very thorough and complete database and very easy to find what you need for quick logins. The ability to make and save recipes is a great asset to the app! i've had for 3 years and it's been of invaluable help with my bulking and cutting bodybuilding cycles. brilliant bar code facility. would love if it was possible to duplicate items for multiple meals and days but other than that very user friendly. i’ve used this as a valuable tool to track my calories for the past 8 years. i like that u can put exercises in too. it helps to keep track of the days i exercise, all in one app. i'm amazed by how many foods are in the data bank. if the food i want is not there, i can usually find one similar. the posted columns are very useful and helpful. i especially like the recipes. It's a great app, never a problem with it, like some other apps. great for counting calories & helping me keep track of what i'm eating. shame about the constant bombardment of ads., and the price of premium for a pensioner is a little steep. Great way to track food, and keep on target when loosing or maintaining weight excellent app. taught me well about macro nutrition facts. it’s a good tracking app, however they made the best feature - the ability to scan the upc - only accessible via the paid app. that was a greedy move. This app has helped me on my way of losing 38 pounds in about 3 months! tracking my food and nutritional values has led me to lose 95 lbs. i feel great, too! used for years!! great for calorie counting and keeping track of my nutrition values. Great app easy to use and excellent for daily use. so far the app has helped me lose 18 ibsbrilliant  it is easy to log your foods. has info on many foods and restaurants. great tool. helps me keep track of meals well. excellent as always the best app to use good app. easy to use  used this for years. fantastic my trainer arman at 24 our fitness set this app up for me so that i could track my progress. i also like the articles on recipes and nutritional information, and sometimes i try to make the dishes. the ability to find specific foods from stores and restaurants makes it easy to do your daily check in. another great feature is the bar code reader, meaning less typing. Great app, keeps me honest! really empowers me to reach my fitness goals. beautiful product with many options to assess your meals. i started using the app after a heart attack. i use it track calories, fat, sodium and exercise. it's great. The app helps me track my macros, so i can keep my protein and fat high and carbs low. functionality is great and relatively user friendly. the database often has any food i need. i've kept the extra weight off for 5 years now.  myfitnesspal is amazing! it has been a huge help in my weight loss journey. the food database is huge, and the barcode scanner makes logging meals super easy. it tracks my progress and syncs with my other fitness apps. highly recommend for anyone looking to get healthier!

negative_reviews_col: dislike took away scanning barcodes paying

Reviews: it’s easy to communicate with other bikers in the community and share experiences.
cleaned_reviews: easy communicate bikers community share experience
positive_reviews_col: easy communicate bikers community share experience
Persona_Insight: CNN.com will feature iReporter photos in a weekly Travel Snapshots gallery. Please submit your best shots of New York for next week. Visit CNN.com/Travel next Wednesday for a new gallery of snapshots. i love fitbit and am obsessed with my watch. over the past 4 years my fitbit has stopped working twice and both times they ask me to send it back and have sent me a brand new one! not many companies would do that so i think it's great. i generally find it so great for tracking all my exercise too and there’s so much you can do on the app. i would never move to any other watch and always recommend them. my fitbit stopped working, customer service was useless and just offered me discount on a new purchase. when i asked how to make a complaint they went from replying promptly to completely ignoring me. i only wish i'd read the reviews years ago as i certainly would've avoided this company. i know they had a premium service that could go in depth but now all basic functions are behind that paywall. my advice: use a different app. used to be a great app, now they have changed it so you need to pay for the most basic of functions. The app runs well most of the time but sometimes doesn't work as well. other than the negative, a good app. they need to sort the money business out. sort it out strava! good at dealing with specific enquiries on rides, but there are some long highlighted general issues that have been raised many times by different people. happy with the overall use of the site via a pc, not so much so on the app. going the paid route opens up so much more and this is both insightful and in my case, helps motivate me. i find the menu easy to navigate, and the info on calories and nutrients is very helpful. search function in “add a food” has some incorrect calorie counts. system automatically adds my exercise calories to my daily total. i can’t opt out of that without upgrading to premium. i have been using myfitnesspal for many years and i had bariatric surgery 3 years ago and this is a very handy tool to use to track. what i used to like i was able to scan my food for free. however now i write my food in because for scanning it isn't free anymore. i still like tracking calories even though i write them in.  myfitnesspal has become my de facto way of keeping track of calories. its accurate, extremely easy to use and would be difficult to do without. this app has a very extensive data base so makes it easy to track my daily food intake. My fitness pal is a brilliant app for managing everything linked to a healthy lifestyle. it is easy to use and if you subscribe to the premium service then you get fantastic value for money. i personally use the basic service for free as my only requirement is the food diary. you will not be disappointed using my fitness pal, and i will guarantee that. i've been using this app to track workouts and meals for years. i trust its data more than any other app i've used. it’s app is easy to use and they everything imaginable listed! i still use the free app and am tempted to try the updated version. Myfitnesspal is right on. always room for improvement, especially for people who don't eat processed food. having to continually put in ingredients i choose to eat is somewhat challenging, especially since i often substitute the alternative ingredients in recipes. i use mFP to track my weight and calories, and it has helped me achieve my fitness goals through the years. fitness pal is easy to use, to check my daily nutrients (calories, carbs, fiber, etc). most of my meal choices are already included in the data. The app is easy to use and perfect for managing my fitness goals. easy ti use and upload myfeedback which was welcomed by the company i bought from. i've been using it consistently for past 2 months and i'm literally seeing the results on weekly basis. i have been using this app daily for over a year. the workout feature is hit and miss, but basically it works well. it’s easy to communicate with other bikers in the community and share experiences. This app is simple to use and really helps me stay on track. wo helpful and easy. it does what i need it to do when i use it right. it has what i want. i’m a long time user and credit my fitness pal with providing both information and the discipline needed to first lose weight and then maintain. i have many friends who complain about not being able to lose weight but have no clue about how many calories, carbs, fats etc they consume. additionally they don’t understand how few calories are actually needed by the human body per day or the amount of exercise needed per day. i was recently diagnosed with gallbladder and liver issues. myfitnesspal has made it much easier to visualize if i’m achieving my macro and nutrient goals for those conditions. with their premium features, it has been worth it! i like that i can scan food to get the nutrition info. i started the south beach diet at my dr’s recommendation and found it hard to find information within the app to follow it. good to count calories and keep trsvk. expensive to go premium.

Sleep tracking is excellent, easy to use with a simple to learn ui. battery life is brilliant, last several days! superb fitness trackers with a very competitive prices. charge 5 worked perfectly and now i am on charge 6, which is just as good with a minor improvements, all adds up to very smooth user experience. great app for cyclists! it's my every day app for recording my sports activities. the segments feature is super addictive. no problem to pay 59 usd per year for it. keep up the good job by continuously adding features! great product and social experience with a positive effect. Each email takes 3-5 working days to get a response, and in my case the support agent took two of those emails to ask the same question twice (adding 10 days to the resolution) it took weeks to resolve a basic problem. a few months back i started tracking my walks. i do 2 miles a day minimum, and just being able to see all the data set me on my journey to lose weight and get fitter. i now use strava, and garmin app together. very good app. i can build my cycling routes easily and also share them with my fellow-cyclists. strava can connect with multiple cycling computers even those that are sold on aliexpress. which makes it easier to follow the routes i build in the strava app. i have been using strava for nearly 3 years. it's great an compatible with my apple watch. i have rated it 4 stars because the have removed feature, making them "summit" (premium) features. i use this almost daily and apart from the dodgy route planner find the website and app interfaces great. excellent performance but the app hcrashes too much no, put a fix on it. only using the free app version so far for my runs and i really like it.  give it a go. Great website for tracking fitness activities. they could do with more premium features for runners. the site seems very geared towards cyclists. it's a great app, with information that can help people through any type of fitness journey. i appreciate the notifications throughout the day to log my meals. it's super easy to look up the foods i have either by the search bar or barcode. i'd like to see more nutrients/minerals in the nutrient breakdown tab. also less ads would be nice. App has helped me lose weight, eat better, exercise more, reach my goals and stay on track/maintain. great database for tracking food at meals, integration of data to/from other health apps and devices, nice goal setting/tracking features. Great app to track your calories and workouts! searching for food, it is a very thorough and complete database and very easy to find what you need for quick logins. The ability to make and save recipes is a great asset to the app! i've had for 3 years and it's been of invaluable help with my bulking and cutting bodybuilding cycles. brilliant bar code facility. would love if it was possible to duplicate items for multiple meals and days but other than that very user friendly. i’ve used this as a valuable tool to track my calories for the past 8 years. i like that u can put exercises in too. it helps to keep track of the days i exercise, all in one app. i'm amazed by how many foods are in the data bank. if the food i want is not there, i can usually find one similar. the posted columns are very useful and helpful. i especially like the recipes. It's a great app, never a problem with it, like some other apps. great for counting calories & helping me keep track of what i'm eating. shame about the constant bombardment of ads., and the price of premium for a pensioner is a little steep. Great way to track food, and keep on target when loosing or maintaining weight excellent app. taught me well about macro nutrition facts. it’s a good tracking app, however they made the best feature - the ability to scan the upc - only accessible via the paid app. that was a greedy move. This app has helped me on my way of losing 38 pounds in about 3 months! tracking my food and nutritional values has led me to lose 95 lbs. i feel great, too! used for years!! great for calorie counting and keeping track of my nutrition values. Great app easy to use and excellent for daily use. so far the app has helped me lose 18 ibsbrilliant  it is easy to log your foods. has info on many foods and restaurants. great tool. helps me keep track of meals well. excellent as always the best app to use good app. easy to use  used this for years. fantastic my trainer arman at 24 our fitness set this app up for me so that i could track my progress. i also like the articles on recipes and nutritional information, and sometimes i try to make the dishes. the ability to find specific foods from stores and restaurants makes it easy to do your daily check in. another great feature is the bar code reader, meaning less typing. Great app, keeps me honest! really empowers me to reach my fitness goals. beautiful product with many options to assess your meals. i started using the app after a heart attack. i use it track calories, fat, sodium and exercise. it's great. The app helps me track my macros, so i can keep my protein and fat high and carbs low. functionality is great and relatively user friendly. the database often has any food i need. i've kept the extra weight off for 5 years now.  myfitnesspal is amazing! it has been a huge help in my weight loss journey. the food database is huge, and the barcode scanner makes logging meals super easy. it tracks my progress and syncs with my other fitness apps. highly recommend for anyone looking to get healthier!

Persona_Insight: CNN.com will feature iReporter photos in a weekly Travel Snapshots gallery. Please submit your best shots of New York for next week. Visit CNN.com/Travel next Wednesday for a new gallery of snapshots. i love fitbit and am obsessed with my watch. over the past 4 years my fitbit has stopped working twice and both times they ask me to send it back and have sent me a brand new one! not many companies would do that so i think it's great. i generally find it so great for tracking all my exercise too and there’s so much you can do on the app. i would never move to any other watch and always recommend them. my fitbit stopped working, customer service was useless and just offered me discount on a new purchase. when i asked how to make a complaint they went from replying promptly to completely ignoring me. i only wish i'd read the reviews years ago as i certainly would've avoided this company. i know they had a premium service that could go in depth but now all basic functions are behind that paywall. my advice: use a different app. used to be a great app, now they have changed it so you need to pay for the most basic of functions. The app runs well most of the time but sometimes doesn't work as well. other than the negative, a good app. they need to sort the money business out. sort it out strava! good at dealing with specific enquiries on rides, but there are some long highlighted general issues that have been raised many times by different people. happy with the overall use of the site via a pc, not so much so on the app. going the paid route opens up so much more and this is both insightful and in my case, helps motivate me. i find the menu easy to navigate, and the info on calories and nutrients is very helpful. search function in “add a food” has some incorrect calorie counts. system automatically adds my exercise calories to my daily total. i can’t opt out of that without upgrading to premium. i have been using myfitnesspal for many years and i had bariatric surgery 3 years ago and this is a very handy tool to use to track. what i used to like i was able to scan my food for free. however now i write my food in because for scanning it isn't free anymore. i still like tracking calories even though i write them in.  myfitnesspal has become my de facto way of keeping track of calories. its accurate, extremely easy to use and would be difficult to do without. this app has a very extensive data base so makes it easy to track my daily food intake. My fitness pal is a brilliant app for managing everything linked to a healthy lifestyle. it is easy to use and if you subscribe to the premium service then you get fantastic value for money. i personally use the basic service for free as my only requirement is the food diary. you will not be disappointed using my fitness pal, and i will guarantee that. i've been using this app to track workouts and meals for years. i trust its data more than any other app i've used. it’s app is easy to use and they everything imaginable listed! i still use the free app and am tempted to try the updated version. Myfitnesspal is right on. always room for improvement, especially for people who don't eat processed food. having to continually put in ingredients i choose to eat is somewhat challenging, especially since i often substitute the alternative ingredients in recipes. i use mFP to track my weight and calories, and it has helped me achieve my fitness goals through the years. fitness pal is easy to use, to check my daily nutrients (calories, carbs, fiber, etc). most of my meal choices are already included in the data. The app is easy to use and perfect for managing my fitness goals. easy ti use and upload myfeedback which was welcomed by the company i bought from. i've been using it consistently for past 2 months and i'm literally seeing the results on weekly basis. i have been using this app daily for over a year. the workout feature is hit and miss, but basically it works well. it’s easy to communicate with other bikers in the community and share experiences. This app is simple to use and really helps me stay on track. wo helpful and easy. it does what i need it to do when i use it right. it has what i want. i’m a long time user and credit my fitness pal with providing both information and the discipline needed to first lose weight and then maintain. i have many friends who complain about not being able to lose weight but have no clue about how many calories, carbs, fats etc they consume. additionally they don’t understand how few calories are actually needed by the human body per day or the amount of exercise needed per day. i was recently diagnosed with gallbladder and liver issues. myfitnesspal has made it much easier to visualize if i’m achieving my macro and nutrient goals for those conditions. with their premium features, it has been worth it! i like that i can scan food to get the nutrition info. i started the south beach diet at my dr’s recommendation and found it hard to find information within the app to follow it. good to count calories and keep trsvk. expensive to go premium.

This app is simple to use and really helps me stay on track. wo helpful and easy. it does what i need it to do when i use it right. it has what i want. i’m a long time user and credit my fitness pal with providing both information and the discipline needed to first lose weight and then maintain. i have many friends who complain about not being able to lose weight but have no clue about how many calories, carbs, fats etc they consume. additionally they don’t understand how few calories are actually needed by the human body per day or the amount of exercise needed per day. i was recently diagnosed with gallbladder and liver issues. myfitnesspal has made it much easier to visualize if i’m achieving my macro and nutrient goals for those conditions. with their premium features, it has been worth it! i like that i can scan food to get the nutrition info. i started the south beach diet at my dr’s recommendation and found it hard to find information within the app to follow it. good to count calories and keep trsvk. expensive to go premium.

Reviews: been a fan for longtime..... great app great product
cleaned_reviews: fan longtime great app great product
positive_reviews_col: fan longtime great app great product
Persona_Insight: Fitbit app used to be excellent. it is in decline unless you pay their monthly subscription! i paid £400 for a piece of tech and can only use its full potential if i keep paying! you can shove it fitbit, no doubt you are making fortunes using all the data you have on us too! i used to love my fitbit and have been a loyal customer for over a decade. the app was always great, simple to use, easy to read, good to see how you were doing over time. recently the app changed but the underlying sections remained usable, now the sleep app has been “updated” it is unusable. we comment but fitbit are ignoring us, time to look at other offerings. Sleep tracking is excellent, easy to use with a simple to learn ui. battery life is brilliant, last several days! superb fitness trackers with a very competitive prices. charge 5 worked perfectly and now i am on charge 6, which is just as good with a minor improvements, all adds up to very smooth user experience. great app for cyclists! it's my every day app for recording my sports activities. the segments feature is super addictive. no problem to pay 59 usd per year for it. keep up the good job by continuously adding features! great product and social experience with a positive effect. Each email takes 3-5 working days to get a response, and in my case the support agent took two of those emails to ask the same question twice (adding 10 days to the resolution) it took weeks to resolve a basic problem. a few months back i started tracking my walks. i do 2 miles a day minimum, and just being able to see all the data set me on my journey to lose weight and get fitter. i now use strava, and garmin app together. very good app. i can build my cycling routes easily and also share them with my fellow-cyclists. strava can connect with multiple cycling computers even those that are sold on aliexpress. which makes it easier to follow the routes i build in the strava app. i have been using strava for nearly 3 years. it's great an compatible with my apple watch. i have rated it 4 stars because the have removed feature, making them "summit" (premium) features. i use this almost daily and apart from the dodgy route planner find the website and app interfaces great. excellent performance but the app hcrashes too much no, put a fix on it. only using the free app version so far for my runs and i really like it.  give it a go. Great website for tracking fitness activities. they could do with more premium features for runners. the site seems very geared towards cyclists. it's a great app, with information that can help people through any type of fitness journey. i appreciate the notifications throughout the day to log my meals. it's super easy to look up the foods i have either by the search bar or barcode. i'd like to see more nutrients/minerals in the nutrient breakdown tab. also less ads would be nice. App has helped me lose weight, eat better, exercise more, reach my goals and stay on track/maintain. great database for tracking food at meals, integration of data to/from other health apps and devices, nice goal setting/tracking features. Great app to track your calories and workouts! searching for food, it is a very thorough and complete database and very easy to find what you need for quick logins. The ability to make and save recipes is a great asset to the app! i've had for 3 years and it's been of invaluable help with my bulking and cutting bodybuilding cycles. brilliant bar code facility. would love if it was possible to duplicate items for multiple meals and days but other than that very user friendly. i’ve used this as a valuable tool to track my calories for the past 8 years. i like that u can put exercises in too. it helps to keep track of the days i exercise, all in one app. i'm amazed by how many foods are in the data bank. if the food i want is not there, i can usually find one similar. the posted columns are very useful and helpful. i especially like the recipes. It's a great app, never a problem with it, like some other apps. great for counting calories & helping me keep track of what i'm eating. shame about the constant bombardment of ads., and the price of premium for a pensioner is a little steep. Great way to track food, and keep on target when loosing or maintaining weight excellent app. taught me well about macro nutrition facts. it’s a good tracking app, however they made the best feature - the ability to scan the upc - only accessible via the paid app. that was a greedy move. This app has helped me on my way of losing 38 pounds in about 3 months! tracking my food and nutritional values has led me to lose 95 lbs. i feel great, too! used for years!! great for calorie counting and keeping track of my nutrition values. Great app easy to use and excellent for daily use. so far the app has helped me lose 18 ibsbrilliant  it is easy to log your foods. has info on many foods and restaurants. great tool. helps me keep track of meals well. excellent as always the best app to use good app. easy to use  used this for years. fantastic my trainer arman at 24 our fitness set this app up for me so that i could track my progress. i also like the articles on recipes and nutritional information, and sometimes i try to make the dishes. the ability to find specific foods from stores and restaurants makes it easy to do your daily check in. another great feature is the bar code reader, meaning less typing. Great app, keeps me honest! really empowers me to reach my fitness goals. beautiful product with many options to assess your meals. i started using the app after a heart attack. i use it track calories, fat, sodium and exercise. it's great. The app helps me track my macros, so i can keep my protein and fat high and carbs low. functionality is great and relatively user friendly. the database often has any food i need. i've kept the extra weight off for 5 years now.  myfitnesspal is amazing! it has been a huge help in my weight loss journey. the food database is huge, and the barcode scanner makes logging meals super easy. it tracks my progress and syncs with my other fitness apps. highly recommend for anyone looking to get healthier!

Visit CNN.com/Travel next Wednesday for a new gallery of snapshots. i love fitbit and am obsessed with my watch. over the past 4 years my fitbit has stopped working twice and both times they ask me to send it back and have sent me a brand new one! not many companies would do that so i think it's great. i generally find it so great for tracking all my exercise too and there’s so much you can do on the app. i would never move to any other watch and always recommend them. my fitbit stopped working, customer service was useless and just offered me discount on a new purchase. when i asked how to make a complaint they went from replying promptly to completely ignoring me. i only wish i'd read the reviews years ago as i certainly would've avoided this company. i know they had a premium service that could go in depth but now all basic functions are behind that paywall. my advice: use a different app. used to be a great app, now they have changed it so you need to pay for the most basic of functions. The app runs well most of the time but sometimes doesn't work as well. other than the negative, a good app. they need to sort the money business out. sort it out strava! good at dealing with specific enquiries on rides, but there are some long highlighted general issues that have been raised many times by different people. happy with the overall use of the site via a pc, not so much so on the app. going the paid route opens up so much more and this is both insightful and in my case, helps motivate me. i find the menu easy to navigate, and the info on calories and nutrients is very helpful. search function in “add a food” has some incorrect calorie counts. system automatically adds my exercise calories to my daily total. i can’t opt out of that without upgrading to premium. i have been using myfitnesspal for many years and i had bariatric surgery 3 years ago and this is a very handy tool to use to track. what i used to like i was able to scan my food for free. however now i write my food in because for scanning it isn't free anymore. i still like tracking calories even though i write them in.  myfitnesspal has become my de facto way of keeping track of calories. its accurate, extremely easy to use and would be difficult to do without. this app has a very extensive data base so makes it easy to track my daily food intake. My fitness pal is a brilliant app for managing everything linked to a healthy lifestyle. it is easy to use and if you subscribe to the premium service then you get fantastic value for money. i personally use the basic service for free as my only requirement is the food diary. you will not be disappointed using my fitness pal, and i will guarantee that. i've been using this app to track workouts and meals for years. i trust its data more than any other app i've used. it’s app is easy to use and they everything imaginable listed! i still use the free app and am tempted to try the updated version. Persona_Insight: bought a fitbit sense 2 2weeks ago, went to charge the device for only the second time and it wouldn't charge. googled and this is a known fault with many negative complaints. completely derailed my motivation and progress, wish i wouldn't have bothered. i paid the £50 for the year only to discover that every run was only partially recorded. i found it difficult to get help from them and when i did it was incomprehensible instructions then a time limit before case closed. wish i could get a refund . waste of money i use this everyday. i wish the option to scan barcodes was not taken away from the basic package. it is not crippling enough to make me want to purchase premium. i love being able to track my meals and i appreciate being ableto view the nutrition consumed.

Each email takes 3-5 working days to get a response, and in my case the support agent took two of those emails to ask the same question twice (adding 10 days to the resolution) it took weeks to resolve a basic problem. a few months back i started tracking my walks. i do 2 miles a day minimum, and just being able to see all the data set me on my journey to lose weight and get fitter. i now use strava, and garmin app together. very good app. i can build my cycling routes easily and also share them with my fellow-cyclists. strava can connect with multiple cycling computers even those that are sold on aliexpress. which makes it easier to follow the routes i build in the strava app. i have been using strava for nearly 3 years. it's great an compatible with my apple watch. i have rated it 4 stars because the have removed feature, making them "summit" (premium) features. i use this almost daily and apart from the dodgy route planner find the website and app interfaces great. excellent performance but the app hcrashes too much no, put a fix on it. only using the free app version so far for my runs and i really like it.  give it a go. Great website for tracking fitness activities. they could do with more premium features for runners. the site seems very geared towards cyclists. it's a great app, with information that can help people through any type of fitness journey. i appreciate the notifications throughout the day to log my meals. it's super easy to look up the foods i have either by the search bar or barcode. i'd like to see more nutrients/minerals in the nutrient breakdown tab. also less ads would be nice. App has helped me lose weight, eat better, exercise more, reach my goals and stay on track/maintain. great database for tracking food at meals, integration of data to/from other health apps and devices, nice goal setting/tracking features. Great app to track your calories and workouts! searching for food, it is a very thorough and complete database and very easy to find what you need for quick logins. The ability to make and save recipes is a great asset to the app! i've had for 3 years and it's been of invaluable help with my bulking and cutting bodybuilding cycles. brilliant bar code facility. would love if it was possible to duplicate items for multiple meals and days but other than that very user friendly. i’ve used this as a valuable tool to track my calories for the past 8 years. i like that u can put exercises in too. it helps to keep track of the days i exercise, all in one app. i'm amazed by how many foods are in the data bank. if the food i want is not there, i can usually find one similar. the posted columns are very useful and helpful. i especially like the recipes. It's a great app, never a problem with it, like some other apps. great for counting calories & helping me keep track of what i'm eating. shame about the constant bombardment of ads., and the price of premium for a pensioner is a little steep. Great way to track food, and keep on target when loosing or maintaining weight excellent app. taught me well about macro nutrition facts. it’s a good tracking app, however they made the best feature - the ability to scan the upc - only accessible via the paid app. that was a greedy move. This app has helped me on my way of losing 38 pounds in about 3 months! tracking my food and nutritional values has led me to lose 95 lbs. i feel great, too! used for years!! great for calorie counting and keeping track of my nutrition values. Great app easy to use and excellent for daily use. so far the app has helped me lose 18 ibsbrilliant  it is easy to log your foods. has info on many foods and restaurants. great tool. helps me keep track of meals well. excellent as always the best app to use good app. easy to use  used this for years. fantastic my trainer arman at 24 our fitness set this app up for me so that i could track my progress. i also like the articles on recipes and nutritional information, and sometimes i try to make the dishes. the ability to find specific foods from stores and restaurants makes it easy to do your daily check in. another great feature is the bar code reader, meaning less typing. Great app, keeps me honest! really empowers me to reach my fitness goals. beautiful product with many options to assess your meals. i started using the app after a heart attack. i use it track calories, fat, sodium and exercise. it's great. The app helps me track my macros, so i can keep my protein and fat high and carbs low. functionality is great and relatively user friendly. the database often has any food i need. i've kept the extra weight off for 5 years now.  myfitnesspal is amazing! it has been a huge help in my weight loss journey. the food database is huge, and the barcode scanner makes logging meals super easy. it tracks my progress and syncs with my other fitness apps. highly recommend for anyone looking to get healthier!

Sleep tracking is excellent, easy to use with a simple to learn ui. battery life is brilliant, last several days! superb fitness trackers with a very competitive prices. charge 5 worked perfectly and now i am on charge 6, which is just as good with a minor improvements, all adds up to very smooth user experience. great app for cyclists! it's my every day app for recording my sports activities. the segments feature is super addictive. no problem to pay 59 usd per year for it. keep up the good job by continuously adding features! great product and social experience with a positive effect. Each email takes 3-5 working days to get a response, and in my case the support agent took two of those emails to ask the same question twice (adding 10 days to the resolution) it took weeks to resolve a basic problem. a few months back i started tracking my walks. i do 2 miles a day minimum, and just being able to see all the data set me on my journey to lose weight and get fitter. i now use strava, and garmin app together. very good app. i can build my cycling routes easily and also share them with my fellow-cyclists. strava can connect with multiple cycling computers even those that are sold on aliexpress. which makes it easier to follow the routes i build in the strava app. i have been using strava for nearly 3 years. it's great an compatible with my apple watch. i have rated it 4 stars because the have removed feature, making them "summit" (premium) features. i use this almost daily and apart from the dodgy route planner find the website and app interfaces great. excellent performance but the app hcrashes too much no, put a fix on it. only using the free app version so far for my runs and i really like it.  give it a go. Great website for tracking fitness activities. they could do with more premium features for runners. the site seems very geared towards cyclists. it's a great app, with information that can help people through any type of fitness journey. i appreciate the notifications throughout the day to log my meals. it's super easy to look up the foods i have either by the search bar or barcode. i'd like to see more nutrients/minerals in the nutrient breakdown tab. also less ads would be nice. App has helped me lose weight, eat better, exercise more, reach my goals and stay on track/maintain. great database for tracking food at meals, integration of data to/from other health apps and devices, nice goal setting/tracking features. Great app to track your calories and workouts! searching for food, it is a very thorough and complete database and very easy to find what you need for quick logins. The ability to make and save recipes is a great asset to the app! i've had for 3 years and it's been of invaluable help with my bulking and cutting bodybuilding cycles. brilliant bar code facility. would love if it was possible to duplicate items for multiple meals and days but other than that very user friendly. i’ve used this as a valuable tool to track my calories for the past 8 years. i like that u can put exercises in too. it helps to keep track of the days i exercise, all in one app. i'm amazed by how many foods are in the data bank. if the food i want is not there, i can usually find one similar. the posted columns are very useful and helpful. i especially like the recipes. It's a great app, never a problem with it, like some other apps. great for counting calories & helping me keep track of what i'm eating. shame about the constant bombardment of ads., and the price of premium for a pensioner is a little steep. Great way to track food, and keep on target when loosing or maintaining weight excellent app. taught me well about macro nutrition facts. it’s a good tracking app, however they made the best feature - the ability to scan the upc - only accessible via the paid app. that was a greedy move. This app has helped me on my way of losing 38 pounds in about 3 months! tracking my food and nutritional values has led me to lose 95 lbs. i feel great, too! used for years!! great for calorie counting and keeping track of my nutrition values. Great app easy to use and excellent for daily use. so far the app has helped me lose 18 ibsbrilliant  it is easy to log your foods. has info on many foods and restaurants. great tool. helps me keep track of meals well. excellent as always the best app to use good app. easy to use  used this for years. fantastic my trainer arman at 24 our fitness set this app up for me so that i could track my progress. i also like the articles on recipes and nutritional information, and sometimes i try to make the dishes. the ability to find specific foods from stores and restaurants makes it easy to do your daily check in. another great feature is the bar code reader, meaning less typing. Great app, keeps me honest! really empowers me to reach my fitness goals. beautiful product with many options to assess your meals. i started using the app after a heart attack. i use it track calories, fat, sodium and exercise. it's great. The app helps me track my macros, so i can keep my protein and fat high and carbs low. functionality is great and relatively user friendly. the database often has any food i need. i've kept the extra weight off for 5 years now.  myfitnesspal is amazing! it has been a huge help in my weight loss journey. the food database is huge, and the barcode scanner makes logging meals super easy. it tracks my progress and syncs with my other fitness apps. highly recommend for anyone looking to get healthier!

Great app, keeps me honest! really empowers me to reach my fitness goals. beautiful product with many options to assess your meals. i started using the app after a heart attack. i use it track calories, fat, sodium and exercise. it's great. The app helps me track my macros, so i can keep my protein and fat high and carbs low. functionality is great and relatively user friendly. the database often has any food i need. i've kept the extra weight off for 5 years now.  myfitnesspal is amazing! it has been a huge help in my weight loss journey. the food database is huge, and the barcode scanner makes logging meals super easy. it tracks my progress and syncs with my other fitness apps. highly recommend for anyone looking to get healthier!

Reviews: easy to use.
cleaned_reviews: easy use
positive_reviews_col: easy use
Persona_Insight: CNN.com will feature iReporter photos in a weekly Travel Snapshots gallery. Please submit your best shots of New York for next week. Visit CNN.com/Travel next Wednesday for a new gallery of snapshots. i love fitbit and am obsessed with my watch. over the past 4 years my fitbit has stopped working twice and both times they ask me to send it back and have sent me a brand new one! not many companies would do that so i think it's great. i generally find it so great for tracking all my exercise too and there’s so much you can do on the app. i would never move to any other watch and always recommend them. my fitbit stopped working, customer service was useless and just offered me discount on a new purchase. when i asked how to make a complaint they went from replying promptly to completely ignoring me. i only wish i'd read the reviews years ago as i certainly would've avoided this company. i know they had a premium service that could go in depth but now all basic functions are behind that paywall. my advice: use a different app. used to be a great app, now they have changed it so you need to pay for the most basic of functions. The app runs well most of the time but sometimes doesn't work as well. other than the negative, a good app. they need to sort the money business out. sort it out strava! good at dealing with specific enquiries on rides, but there are some long highlighted general issues that have been raised many times by different people. happy with the overall use of the site via a pc, not so much so on the app. going the paid route opens up so much more and this is both insightful and in my case, helps motivate me. i find the menu easy to navigate, and the info on calories and nutrients is very helpful. search function in “add a food” has some incorrect calorie counts. system automatically adds my exercise calories to my daily total. i can’t opt out of that without upgrading to premium. i have been using myfitnesspal for many years and i had bariatric surgery 3 years ago and this is a very handy tool to use to track. what i used to like i was able to scan my food for free. however now i write my food in because for scanning it isn't free anymore. i still like tracking calories even though i write them in.  myfitnesspal has become my de facto way of keeping track of calories. its accurate, extremely easy to use and would be difficult to do without. this app has a very extensive data base so makes it easy to track my daily food intake. My fitness pal is a brilliant app for managing everything linked to a healthy lifestyle. it is easy to use and if you subscribe to the premium service then you get fantastic value for money. i personally use the basic service for free as my only requirement is the food diary. you will not be disappointed using my fitness pal, and i will guarantee that. i've been using this app to track workouts and meals for years. i trust its data more than any other app i've used. it’s app is easy to use and they everything imaginable listed! i still use the free app and am tempted to try the updated version. Myfitnesspal is right on. always room for improvement, especially for people who don't eat processed food. having to continually put in ingredients i choose to eat is somewhat challenging, especially since i often substitute the alternative ingredients in recipes. i use mFP to track my weight and calories, and it has helped me achieve my fitness goals through the years. fitness pal is easy to use, to check my daily nutrients (calories, carbs, fiber, etc). most of my meal choices are already included in the data. The app is easy to use and perfect for managing my fitness goals. easy ti use and upload myfeedback which was welcomed by the company i bought from. i've been using it consistently for past 2 months and i'm literally seeing the results on weekly basis. i have been using this app daily for over a year. the workout feature is hit and miss, but basically it works well. it’s easy to communicate with other bikers in the community and share experiences. This app is simple to use and really helps me stay on track. wo helpful and easy. it does what i need it to do when i use it right. it has what i want. i’m a long time user and credit my fitness pal with providing both information and the discipline needed to first lose weight and then maintain. i have many friends who complain about not being able to lose weight but have no clue about how many calories, carbs, fats etc they consume. additionally they don’t understand how few calories are actually needed by the human body per day or the amount of exercise needed per day. i was recently diagnosed with gallbladder and liver issues. myfitnesspal has made it much easier to visualize if i’m achieving my macro and nutrient goals for those conditions. with their premium features, it has been worth it! i like that i can scan food to get the nutrition info. i started the south beach diet at my dr’s recommendation and found it hard to find information within the app to follow it. good to count calories and keep trsvk. expensive to go premium.

Persona_Insight: i am too traumatized to go into detail. my advice is to steer clear of this company. dealing with customer services is a surreal experience. a trustscore of 1 out of 5 should tell you all you need to know. An expensive bit of kit, which has been reliable for the two years i have owned it. my really big concern is having spent a lot of money on its initial purchase to really benefit you have to then pay to use all the functions within the app. knowing what i know now in no way, shape or form would buy another fitbit. realistically at its purchase the complete and full app should come with it all included. i don’t get fooled twice and i hope none of you out there get fooled once. i’m writing this regarding a versa 4 my wife bought for me as a christmas gift in december 2022. this watch recently died and could not be reset, less than 6 months after warranty ended. fitbit support offered a 35% discount on a new one instead of replacing it.  don't buy this product or do so at your own risk.  fitbit charge5 stopped syncing with the mobile app 12apr 2024. i bought it in april 2023. i tried all the steps available online and on the fitbit community forum. nothing worked. 16 apr 2024 - i had a live chat with fitbit onine. They were helpful and my fitbit is nowsyncing with mobile app. i was totally unaware they could do this, would not refund payment. be very careful if you use their app. it keeps you healthy  you help me stay on track, easy to use. if yiy switch phone they won't honor it they blame it on apple very dissatisfied customer.

Persona_Insight: Fitbit app used to be excellent. it is in decline unless you pay their monthly subscription! i paid £400 for a piece of tech and can only use its full potential if i keep paying! you can shove it fitbit, no doubt you are making fortunes using all the data you have on us too! i used to love my fitbit and have been a loyal customer for over a decade. the app was always great, simple to use, easy to read, good to see how you were doing over time. recently the app changed but the underlying sections remained usable, now the sleep app has been “updated” it is unusable. we comment but fitbit are ignoring us, time to look at other offerings. Sleep tracking is excellent, easy to use with a simple to learn ui. battery life is brilliant, last several days! superb fitness trackers with a very competitive prices. charge 5 worked perfectly and now i am on charge 6, which is just as good with a minor improvements, all adds up to very smooth user experience. great app for cyclists! it's my every day app for recording my sports activities. the segments feature is super addictive. no problem to pay 59 usd per year for it. keep up the good job by continuously adding features! great product and social experience with a positive effect. Each email takes 3-5 working days to get a response, and in my case the support agent took two of those emails to ask the same question twice (adding 10 days to the resolution) it took weeks to resolve a basic problem. a few months back i started tracking my walks. i do 2 miles a day minimum, and just being able to see all the data set me on my journey to lose weight and get fitter. i now use strava, and garmin app together. very good app. i can build my cycling routes easily and also share them with my fellow-cyclists. strava can connect with multiple cycling computers even those that are sold on aliexpress. which makes it easier to follow the routes i build in the strava app. i have been using strava for nearly 3 years. it's great an compatible with my apple watch. i have rated it 4 stars because the have removed feature, making them "summit" (premium) features. i use this almost daily and apart from the dodgy route planner find the website and app interfaces great. excellent performance but the app hcrashes too much no, put a fix on it. only using the free app version so far for my runs and i really like it.  give it a go. Great website for tracking fitness activities. they could do with more premium features for runners. the site seems very geared towards cyclists. it's a great app, with information that can help people through any type of fitness journey. i appreciate the notifications throughout the day to log my meals. it's super easy to look up the foods i have either by the search bar or barcode. i'd like to see more nutrients/minerals in the nutrient breakdown tab. also less ads would be nice. App has helped me lose weight, eat better, exercise more, reach my goals and stay on track/maintain. great database for tracking food at meals, integration of data to/from other health apps and devices, nice goal setting/tracking features. Great app to track your calories and workouts! searching for food, it is a very thorough and complete database and very easy to find what you need for quick logins. The ability to make and save recipes is a great asset to the app! i've had for 3 years and it's been of invaluable help with my bulking and cutting bodybuilding cycles. brilliant bar code facility. would love if it was possible to duplicate items for multiple meals and days but other than that very user friendly. i’ve used this as a valuable tool to track my calories for the past 8 years. i like that u can put exercises in too. it helps to keep track of the days i exercise, all in one app. i'm amazed by how many foods are in the data bank. if the food i want is not there, i can usually find one similar. the posted columns are very useful and helpful. i especially like the recipes. It's a great app, never a problem with it, like some other apps. great for counting calories & helping me keep track of what i'm eating. shame about the constant bombardment of ads., and the price of premium for a pensioner is a little steep. Reviews: my fitness pal is used for more than just weight loss!  i have had sigificant medical issues, had been put on a non amylose diet. i used mfp to make sure i was getting enough calories. when i started the diet you have to eat alot, most foods are low calorie. my husband suggested i start using it as i was feeling bad and he thought i might not be getting enough calories. he was right, i plugged in the foods and i was only eating 700 calories. i used the app to plan out the whole day to get enough calories, then figured out the right number to lose weight. using this app i lost 38 pounds since january of 2024. also had a problem with my stomach and had to use a liquid diet for 2 weeks. i was able to see the nutrition and the calories. learned my sodium was too low on the app and added salt. im still losing weight want to be 140, am very close now. will continue to use the app for nutrition info when i maintain my weight and if i start gaining will cut calories back to lose the extra and maintain my weight! thank you my fitness pal!!
